content: effortless christmas bauble materials f/5 3 75mm hook #4 worsted weight yarn in your chosen shades yarn needle for weaving in ends ornament hanging hook skill level beginner measurement 3 gauge gauge is not critical for this project if you use larger or smaller hook/yarn your project will end up a little larger or smaller match your hook size to your yarn size abbreviations ca cb cc color a color b color c chain chain double_crochet double_crochet round round repeat repeat st s stitch es slip_stitch slip_stitch ws wrong side # indicates number of sts you should have at the end of that round pattern notes the ch2 or ch3 at the beginning of every round counts as a double_crochet as this is an ornament that won t be handled much you should be ok to just work over each end with the next sts and not have to do much weaving with a yarn needle to tuck them in i just cut the ends off since they aren t visible from the outside christmas bauble​ ​ make 2 start with ca round 1 ​ ch3 11dc in third chain from hook 12dc ​ see image 1 fasten_off join cb in the space between any 2 double_crochet from round 1 ​ see image 2 round 2 ​ ch2 1dc in same space 2dc in next space repeat around to end 24dc ​ see image 3 fasten_off join cc in the space between any 2dc group from round 2 ​ see image 4 round 3 ​ ch2 2dc in same space 3dc in next space repeat around to end 36dc ​ ​ see image 5 fasten_off first bauble piece for second piece do not fasten_off joining hold both bauble pieces with ws facing each other and slip_stitch through both thicknesses to attach continue slip_stitch ing around to end ​ ​ see image 6 fasten_off and weave in end with invisible join here s a great tutorial for how to complete that from g​ leeful things ​ add an ornament hook or a loop of
